page.title: 10Tourism in Charnwood
page.content: Only a small proportion of the thousands of visitors to this area are tourists (i.e.whose journeys have not originated from home) and even these tend to be staying with friends or realtives.Tourist accommodation is represented by a Youth Hostel of 22 beds at Copt Oak which also takes a few caravans & a touring caravan site with no sanitation at Bawdon Castle Farm near the B591.There are no restaurants or cafes.Day visitors account for over 90% and the numbers rise to a peak on fine sunny Sunday afternoons in summertimes but continue at a high level all round the year. Many are taking a leisure drive through the attractive countryside, other activities are visiting Beacon Hill,following footpaths,picnicking & nature study.The proximity of the M1 extends the catchment zone.
